body: Thank you for opening the issue. Do you want to contribute a fix ?

issue.title: WPS612 false positive for keyword arguments with different default values

repository.name: wemake-python-styleguide
repository.description: The strictest and most opinionated python linter ever!

issue.body:
### What's wrong

I already wrote all in details for Pylint, please read: https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/7287 
```python
class Foo:
    def __init__(*, bar = 10):
         ...

class Child(Foo):
    def __init__(*, bar = 99999):
         super().__init__(bar=bar)
```

### How it should be

no warnings

### Flake8 version and plugins

not relevant

### pip information

not relevant

### OS information

not relevant

issue.title: `useless-super-delegation` when overriding `Exception` to have different default argument

labels.name: False Positive ðŸ¦Ÿ
labels.description: A message is emitted but nothing is wrong with the code

labels.name: Needs PR
labels.description: This issue is accepted, sufficiently specified and now needs an implementation

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
### Bug description

```python
# pylint: disable=missing-module-docstring,missing-class-docstring
class CustomError(Exception):
    def __init__(self, message="default"):
        super().__init__(message)
```

### Configuration

_No response_

### Command used

```shell
pylint a.py
```


### Pylint output

```shell
************* Module a
a.py:3:4: W0235: Useless super delegation in method '__init__' (useless-super-delegation)
```


### Expected behavior

No error, because this is not a useless super delegation. The method signature is different. A default value has been introduced. (Also discussed in #839 from which the rule was introduced).

### Pylint version

```shell
pylint 2.14.5
astroid 2.11.7
Python 3.9.13 (main, Aug 11 2022, 13:40:36)
[Clang 13.1.6 (clang-1316.0.21.2.5)]
```


### OS / Environment

macOS 12.4

### Additional dependencies

_No response_

issue.title: Add a functional test for the `useless-parent-delegation` checker.

labels.name: Skip news :mute:
labels.description: This change does not require a changelog entry

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for submitting a PR to pylint!

To ease the process of reviewing your PR, do make sure to complete the following boxes.

- [ ] Write a good description on what the PR does.
- [ ] Create a news fragment with `towncrier create <IssueNumber>.<type>` which will be
  included in the changelog. `<type>` can be one of: new_check, removed_check, extension,
  false_positive, false_negative, bugfix, other, internal. If necessary you can write
  details or offer examples on how the new change is supposed to work.
- [ ] If you used multiple emails or multiple names when contributing, add your mails
      and preferred name in ``script/.contributors_aliases.json``
-->

## Type of Changes

<!-- Leave the corresponding lines for the applicable type of change: -->


## Description

<!-- If this PR references an issue without fixing it: -->

Add a functional test for an alternative scenario.

Closes #7287

body: Hey all. It looks like the example provided is not a false positive since adding it to the functional tests yields a successful run. Perhaps the Pylint version which the pre-commit uses is a little out of date?
